tuv.seg: Changing job: tax, PRSI and pension
Athrú poist: cáin, ÁSPC agus pinsean
If you are changing your job, (that is, leaving your existing job and commencing a new one), there are a number of steps you should take in relation to tax and social insurance contributions (PRSI)

Má tá tú ag athrú poist (is é sin, má tá tú ag fágáil do phost reatha agus ag tosú ar cheann nua), tá roinnt céimeanna ba cheart duit a thógáil maidir le cáin agus ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta (ÁSPC)
In addition, there are important issues to be aware of, regarding your pension
Chomh maith leis sin, tá ceisteanna tábhachtacha le cur san áireamh, maidir le pinsin
Whenever you leave a job you should get a P45 certificate from your employer
Ba cheart duit teastas P45 a fháil ó d’fhostóir agus tú ag fágáil poist
Your P45 is a statement from your employer that shows your pay, tax, Universal Social Charge (USC), and PRSI details for the year up to the date you leave
Is ráiteas ó d’fhostóir an P45 a thaispeánann an méid pá a fuair tú chun dáta, an méid cánach, Mhuirir Shóisialta Uilíoch agus árachais shóisialta (ÁSPC) a d’íoc tú chun dáta
When you begin work at your new job, you will need this P45 to give to your new employer
Nuair a thosaíonn tú ar do phost nua beidh an fhoirm P45 seo ag teastáil uait chun í a thabhairt do d’fhostóir nua
Your new employer then takes some details from your P45 and then sends your P45 to the tax office on your behalf
Tógann d’fhostóir nua roinnt sonraí ó do P45 agus seolann sé/sí do P45 chuig an oifig cánach ar do shon
This is to notify the tax office that you have now commenced working for a new employer and ensures that they are deducting tax appropriately
Is fógra é sin don oifig chánach go bhfuil tú tar éis obair a thosú le fostóir nua agus déanann sé cinnte go bhfuil siad ag baint cánach i gceart
When you give the P45 to your new employer, they will:
Nuair a thugann tú an P45 do d’fhostóir nua, déanfaidh sé/sí:
• Operate PAYE in accordance with the tax credits and standard cut off point details shown on the P45 until they receives a tax credit certificate from the tax office

• An córas ÍMAT a chur i bhfeidhm bunaithe ar na creidmheasanna cánacha agus na sonraí faoin scoithphointe bunúsach taispeánta ar an teastas P45 go dtí go bhfaigheann sé/sí teastas creidmheasanna cánach ón oifig chánach
• Notify the tax office that you have changed jobs so that a tax credit certificate can be issued for your new job
• Tuairisc a chur chuig an oifig chánach go bhfuil do phost athraithe agat le gur féidir teastas creidmheasanna cánach don phost nua a eisiúint duit
If you do not give your new employer a P45 certificate, emergency tax will be deducted
Muna dtugann tú an P45 do d’fhostóir nua, bainfear cáin éigeandála díot
If your employer has not received either a:
Mura mbeidh siad seo a leanas faighte ag d’fhostóir:
• Certificate of tax credits from the tax office or,
• Teastas creidmheasanna cánach ón oifig cánach nó
• P45 certificate (parts 2 and 3) from you, in respect of your previous employment,
• Teastas P45 (codanna 2 agus 3) uait féin, maidir le d'fhostaíocht roimhe seo,
your employer will be obliged to deduct tax on an emergency basis when paying your employee's wages or salary
beidh sé d'oibleagáid ar d’fhostóir cáin a asbhaint ar bhonn éigeandála nuair a bheidh siad ag íoc do chéad phá nó tuarastal mar fhostaí
This means that they will give you a temporary tax credit for the first month of employment but tax deductions are increased progressively from the second month onwards
Ciallaíonn sé sin go dtabharfaidh siad liúntas saor ó cháin sealadach duit don chéad mhí fostaíochta agus méadófar asbhaintí cánach de réir a chéile ón dara mí ar aghaidh
The effect of emergency basis is that after 4 weeks, no tax credits are given and tax is paid at the higher rate from week 9, regardless of the level of pay
Is é an toradh a bhíonn ag an mbunús éigeandála ná: tar éis 4 seachtaine, ní thugtar aon liúntas shaor ó cháin agus íoctar cáin ag an ráta is airde ó sheachtain 9, beag beann ar an leibhéal pá
It makes sense therefore to avoid the emergency basis by following the simple steps outlined earlier when you start work in Ireland
Déanann sé ciall mar sin an bunús éigeandála sin a sheachaint trí na céimeanna simplí a tugadh cuntas orthu ní ba luaithe a leanúint nuair a thosaíonn tú ag obair in Éirinn
Details of emergency tax rates are on the Revenue website
Léigh tuilleadh faisnéise faoi cáin éigeandála anseo
More information can be found in our document about tax and starting work
Léigh tuilleadh eolais faoi cáin agus obair a thosú anseo
Most employers and employees (over 16 years of age) pay social insurance contributions into the national Social Insurance Fund
Íocann an chuid is mó d’fhostóirí agus fostaithe (os cionn 16 bliain d’aois) ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta isteach i gCiste Árachais Shóisialta náisiúnta
Social insurance contributions entitle you to a range of benefits that are administered by the Department of Social Protection
Tugann ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta teidlíocht duit do réimse sochar a riarann an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí

It is important therefore to inform your new employer of your Personal Public Service Number (PPS number) as this will ensure that your combined social welfare contributions are recorded and that your entitlement to benefits is protected for the future

Tá sé tábhachtach, mar sin, d’uimhir phearsanta seirbhíse poiblí, (UPSP) a thabhairt do d’fhostóir ionas go ndéanfar taifead ar do ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta comhcheangailte agus go gcosnófar do theidlíocht do shocair don todhchaí
You can find more information in our document about social insurance (PRSI)
Léigh tuilleadh faoi árachas sóisialta (ÁSPC)
Changing jobs and pensions
Athrú poist agus pinsin
Occupational pensions: If you have an occupational pension your benefits from the pension scheme may be preserved within the scheme or transferred to another scheme
Pinsin ghairme: Má tá pinsean gairme agat d’fhéadfaí do shochair ón scéim pinsean a chaomhnú laistigh den scéim nó a aistriú go scéim eile
Legislation requires that when a member leaves a scheme that they must be provided with a Leaving Service Options letter within 2 months of their exit from the scheme
De réir na reachtaíochta, nuair a fhágann ball scéim pinsean, caithfear litir le Roghanna Fágála Seirbhíse a sholáthar dóibh faoi cheann 2 mhí ón tráth a fhágann siad an scéim
This letter should detail any options relating to the members’ benefits
Ba chóir go dtabharfaí mionsonraí sa litir seo a bhaineann le haon roghanna maidir le sochair na mball
A preserved benefit means that you get a pension when you reach the scheme's normal retirement age
Ciallaíonn sochar caomhnaithe go bhfaigheann tú pinsean nuair a shroicheann tú gnáthaois scoir na scéime
If you have less than 2 years' contributions to the scheme, you can get a refund of your own contributions (but not any contributions made by your employer)
Má tá níos lú ná 2 bhliain de ranníocaíochtaí agat sa scéim, is féidir leat aisíoc a fháil ar do chuid ranníocaíochtaí féin (ach ní bheidh aisíoc ar ranníocaíochtaí ar bith atá déanta ag d’fhostóir)
This refund will be taxed, as you received tax relief when you made the contribution
Beidh an t-aisíoc seo inchánach, toisc go bhfuair tú faoiseamh cánach nuair a rinne tú an ranníocaíocht
Before you leave your employment, you should talk to the person in the company who has responsibilty for administering the pension scheme, as each scheme has its own rules
Sula bhfágann tú d’fhostaíocht, ba chóir duit labhairt leis an duine sa chomhlacht atá freagrach as an scéim pinsean a riaradh, mar baineann rialacha ar leith le gach scéim
Personal Retirement Savings Accounts (PRSA): If you have a PRSA you can stop or start it when you choose, without charges, by contacting your PRSA provider

Cuntais Choigiltis Scoir Phearsanta (CCSP): Má tá CCSP agat, gan táillí ar bith i gceist, is féidir CCSP a stopadh nó a thosú ag tráth ar bith a roghnaítear trí theagmháil a dhéanamh le do sholáthraí CCSP
Your PRSA is a contract between you and a PRSA provider in the form of an investment account
Is conradh é do CCSP i bhfoirm cuntais infheistíochta idir tú féin agus soláthraí CCSP
PRSAs allow you to change employment and continue to use the same PRSA
Ceadaíonn CCSP duit fostaíocht a athrú agus leanúint ar aghaidh leis an gCCSP céanna
For further information, see the Pension Authority’s booklet, PRSAs – a consumer and employer's guide (pdf)
Chun tuilleadh eolais a fháil, féach ar leabhrán na hÚdaráis Pinsean, PRSAs – a consumer and employer's guide (pdf)
You are entitled to a P45 certificate when you leave work
Tá tú i dteideal teastais P45 nuair a éiríonn tú as post
If you experience any difficulty in obtaining a P45 from your employer, you should notify your tax office
Má tá deacracht ar bith agat foirm P45 a fháil ó d’fhostóir, ba cheart duit d'oifig chánach a chur ar an eolas
If you have difficulty in obtaining your P45 from your former employer, contact your tax office or contact your regional PAYE lo-call telephone service
Má tá deacracht agat do theastas P45 a fháil ó d’iarfhostóir, téigh i dteagmháil le d’oifig chánach áitiúil nó téigh i dteagmháil le do sheirbhís fhóin reigiúnda ar chostas íseal de chuid ÍMAT
For information on your PPS number, contact your local Intreo centre or social welfare office
Téigh i dteagmháil le d’ionad Intreo nó oifig leasa shóisialta áitiúil chun eolas a fháil faoi d’uimhir phearsanta seirbhíse poiblí
Occupational pensions and PRSAs are regulated by the Pensions Authority
Is é an tÚdarás Pinsean an comhlacht reachtúil atá freagreach sa rialú scéimeanna pinsin in Éirinn
Its free booklet What are my Pension Options?
Soláthraíonn a leabhráin saor in aisce Cad iad na Roghanna Pinsin atá agam?
' (pdf) provides you with an overview of the pension arrangements available
(pdf) forbhreathnú ar na socruithe pinsin ar fáil
In addition, this booklet sets out the options suitable in various circumstances and requirements
Leagann an leabhráin amach freisin na roghanna oiriúnacha le cúinsí agus riachtanais éagsúla
If you have any queries in connection with a pension, contact the Pensions Authority's Information Unit
Má tá aon ceist agat faoi phinsean, téigh i dteagmháil leis an Aonad Eolais na hÚdaráis Pinsean
